CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant initiated a payment warrant procedure for repayment of debts on DATE which , by the protest of the debtor , developed into court proceedings .
CARDINAL . The procedure was suspended on CARDINAL DATE due to other pending court proceedings , which ended in DATE .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , after several hearings , the first - instance court partly found for the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP On appeal , ORG quashed the decision and remitted the case on DATE .
CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , after the transfer of the case from CARDINAL court to another for reasons of jurisdiction , the GPE IV / XV ORG partly found for the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On appeal , the second - instance court found for the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . In review proceedings , ORG upheld this decision on DATE . Its ruling was served on the applicant on CARDINAL DATE .
